de.deadmist.deadSimpleHttp.server

Class HTTPServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • de.deadmist.deadSimpleHttp.server.HTTPServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class HTTPServer
extends Thread
    A simple HTTP server, functionality is provided through RequestHandlers that are matched to the requested URL.

    Per default no handlers are registered on the server and every request will be responded with a 501 Not Implemented error.
    If you want to add functionality you need to supply a HashMap containing a regex for matching the URL and the handler.
    When a new connection is made the regex is matched against the url and the handler with the longest match will be selected to process the request.
    If two or more regex match the same amount of characters the longer regex is chosen. If two regex have the same length only one will be chosen.

    • You can use the provided FileHandler with the regex "^((\/|[a-zA-Z0-9]+))+\.[a-zA-Z0-9]+$" for providing basic serving of files.
    • To hide the 501 Not Implemented - Missing Handler error messages you can use the CatchAllHandler catch anything not covered by another handler and return a 404 Not Found error instead.
    Author:
    Deadmist

    • Constructor Detail

      • HTTPServer

        public HTTPServer(int port,
                  int backlog,
                  HashMap<String,RequestHandler> handlers)
           throws IOException
        Creates a new server instance.
        Start the server by calling start()
        Parameters:
        port - Port to listen on (80 is default for HTTP)
        backlog - Size of the backlog, the bigger the more connections can be waiting
        handlers - List of handlers to handle requests
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown when no socket can be created
